div.h2: Get A “Bird’s Eye” View of SAU16…

div.div: Follow Superintendent Ryan on Twitter to see what’s happening in our community:

img.alt: and learn more about our community!
img.title: and learn more about our community!

div.h2: … and learn more about our community!

div.div: SAU16 believes in partnering with area resources whenever we can. That’s why we’ve built a new Local Events Page to share information, events, and opportunities to benefit residents and families.

Please read the attached letter for the latest COVID-19 update from SAU16.
As this fluid situation changes, we will continue to keep you informed as we recieve and confirm information.
COVID-19 UPDATE #6 March 12, 2020 (click to open)
This Saturday’s Educator Recruitment Job Fair, at EHS, has been postponed due to health precautions. Please stay tuned for future rescheduling.

Competency-based learning refers to systems of instruction, assessment, grading, and academic reporting that are based on students demonstrating that they have learned the knowledge and skills they are expected to learn as they progress through their education. The general goal of competency-based learning is to ensure that students are acquiring the knowledge and skills that are deemed essential to success in school, higher education, careers, and adult life.
The 2019-2020 SAU 16 school opening Convocation took place at Exeter High School on Thursday, August 22, 2019.
The new student online registration portal is to be used for any new student that has recently enrolled in an SAU 16 school. Please check back in early March for the registration link.

div.p: SAU 16 makes the safety of all students and staff in our schools a top priority. In our continuing efforts to improve the safety at all SAU 16 schools, we are introducing a new service.

Starting on April 11, 2018, SAU 16 will be offering a Quick Tip digital hot line which is an anonymous reporting system. This “See Something, Say Something” tip line allows anyone to communicate concerns about unsafe behavior within the SAU 16 community.
To access the system, click this Quick Tip Hotline link.
Simply fill in the form. Providing your contact information is optional, otherwise you will remain anonymous. Please see the Quick Tip Protocol for more information.

Exeter Region Cooperative School District Food Service Department is seeking individuals who would like to work in a child friendly environment. School year calendar and school hours. No experience needed, we will train. Must be able to lift up to 50lbs, able to stand for long period of time, and able to bend. This position does offer some benefits. Sorry no health insurance. EOE. If interested please contact Jeanne Pierce at 603-775-8449 or email: Jpierce@sau16.org.
Come and work with us! SAU 16 utilizes an online application process which helps to make the interview process efficient.
View open positions, apply online, and access links for current employees in our new and improved Employment Section.

As leaders in SAU 16, school security and safety are a top priority. We consider the safety of your children and our staff when making decisions each day. Below is a list of the work we have done to support these efforts. Please know we continue to discuss ongoing security measures as part of our overall mission here in SAU 16.

p.strong: Safety & Security Measures List | ALICE Training

div.p: Each graduate demonstrates engaged learning and citizenship through the ability to solve problems independently and collaboratively with perseverance and resilience, and communicates solutions with confidence and empathy.

30 Linden Street, Exeter, NH 03833 We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
SAU16 Notice of Disclaimer, Copyright and Privacy Statement
Website Changes: If you have an sau16.org account, and would like to request information to be added , edited, or removed from this website, please fill out the Website Change Form.

div.p: If you require assistance with accessing any of the information on this page, please contact the IT helpdesk at: helpdesk@sau16.org.
If language assistance is needed for Civil Rights purposes, please contact the NH Commission for Human Rights at: 1-603-271-2767, dial “0”, ask for an interpreter.
Si asistencia de lenguaje es necesario para civiles derechos propósitos, por favor contacto con la Comisión NH los Derechos Humanos a: 1-603-271-2767, marcar “0”, pedir una interpreter.
